document_title: Chronic enteritis: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content: Chronic inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is a chronic inflammatory disease of the intestinal tract including two main groups: ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease (regional enteritis). The pathogenesis of chronic enteritis is still unknown. However, interactions between environmental factors, the body's immune factors, the patient's microbiome, and genetics play an important role. In recent years, people have noted abnormalities in the intestinal microflora in Crohn's disease, with an increase in some pathogenic bacteria strains such as E.Coli, proteobacteria, Actinobacteria and a decrease in Firmicutes and Bacteroides strains. (2)
